result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon C Shaw was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay $250.00 fine plus costs.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
---------------------------

Reimburse City of Whitewater Police Department in the amount of $120.00 for "buy money."
---------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
---------------------------

No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
---------------------------

IT IS ORDERED, pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.015, that upon successful completion of the sentence imposed WITH NO VIOLATION OF THE RULES OF PROBATION, the Clerk of Court shall issue an order expunging the record.
---------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
---------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
---------------------------

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on March 18, 2016 at or before 5:00 p.m. on that date.

The above named defendant having appeared before the Court on  February 17, 2016, and having been convicted of Manufacture/Deliver THC(<=200g), contrary to Sec.961.41(1)(h)1, Wis. THE STATE OF WISCONSIN, TO ANY LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICER:
NOW, THEREFORE, You are commanded forthwith to arrest and bring the said defendant to the Walworth County Sheriff's Department to serve said sentence.

BOND TO COVER ALL FILES 15CT374 &15CT23 & 2014CF000325 & 2014CT000210 & 14CT277.  MUST POST $500.00 CASH. (Already posted 7-30-2014).    Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.
